title: Textile, 1995-50-316-a,b,c, 2nd half of 18th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed resist, vat dyed in indigo, on cotton plain weave
markings:
On back of all three.
a, '22' printed and spots of painted white resist
b. '?J6' and resist printed 'AMF within a large C'
c. '11?73' and 'CC' printed in black on a resist painted spot.
dimensions:
a. Warp: 75.2cm (29 1/2 in.) Weft: 28.2 cm (11 1/16 in.)
b. Warp: 72 cm (28 1/4 in.) Weft 31 cm (12 1/4 in.)
c. Warp: 31.5 cm (12 1/4 in.) Weft: 27 cm (10 3/4 in.)
description: Three pieces of what once was the same length of fabric with manufacturer's marks (no name) on the back.  Design of pomegranite-like shape and arching leaves in white on a blue ground.
